alert.note: Alert for Albemarle (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 8:35PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia, northwest Virginia and western Virginia, including the following counties: in central Virginia, Albemarle, City of Charlottesville, Greene and Orange. In northwest Virginia, Madison, Page and Shenandoah. In western Virginia, Rockingham. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 835 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charlottesville... Shenandoah... Stanley... Stanardsville... Free Union... Big Meadows... Campbell... Westmoreland... Hollymead... Elkton... Ruckersville... Ivy... Lydia... Amicus... Haneytown... Mcmullen... Saint George... Quinque... Shady Grove... Fletcher... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
